don't want the those living around anymore and you want to migrate those modern languages like net so you have

you have options that you can lift and shift the infrastructure over there's a lot of great tools in the marketplace there's tools provided by aws you can
use to do that and make it a very effective process
so accenture has been doing migrations for many but many different years we started doing mainframe migrations

there's a few key points up here that you can read it really boils down to aligning your it services

so once you develop that you also have a gauge to understand how successful you

one of the other key points is you're developing your strategy is also looking at tco and a lot of folks think tco they

physical space in your data center environment into account your electricity and your

and as you rationalize that you can compare what does it cost in your cloud environment at some points you may get

so moving on to the next phase in the process after you develop your cloud strategy one of the key things that you need to do
is defining your assessment approach how are you going to discover all of your applications
and assess how they fit into the cloud environment so the first thing you may
want to do is you have some applications in mind that are probably great cloud candidates so you want to include those
you may have some documentation about those applications as well that you want to include you may have a cb cmdb in your

and once you've gathered all that information you've done your discovery you want to assess your application portfolio you want to understand what

may not want to migrate them right now you may want to gain experience doing your first migrations and then tackle a
little bit later on in the next slide i'll talk here a little bit about what is your assessment
criteria as you're going through your application portfolio some of the key things in the best practice we've seen
working with our clients is first to identify what would disqualify your applications from moving to the cloud
and typically we go through you know maybe 10 or 15 questions that you want to have in there and they're probably
very business focused questions for instance uh you know data privacy do you want to put pii pci data into your cloud
environment some clients choose to and others accept the risk of doing that and putting in a public cloud environment
and you can use encryption some clients say that we will accept pii and pci data in the cloud if it's
encrypted so that could be one of your assessment criterias as well you also want to look at the support for
your environment some vendors don't support their software in cloud environments so it's important to
understand that before you assess your application and start migrating into the into your cloud environment there's also
some technical things you may want not want to move databases that are 50 terabytes onto a dbms or mysql system
perhaps with new services released today you can do that but you need to look through there's
some technical challenges and limitations in your cloud provider in aws that you may want to work around you
don't want to migrate those applications yet and some other key things to point out
is interesting things as we've worked with our clients in the past is some
software companies use usb licensing like usb dongles attached to your servers well if you have that it's
probably not a good candidate to move to your cloud environment because it probably won't work out there very well
and as you define that assessment criteria the next step is planning your migration
there's a few key steps in doing that you want to bucket your applications together understand which are the

like for like migrations you're going to move to your cloud environment right away you may want to remediate a
